RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the vehicles' drivers: RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Border Patrol agents: Jorge Luis Trevino and Marco Montemayor

Defendant who challenges the stop of his white sedan by United States Border Patrol Agent Trevino, arguing that the factors known to Agent Trevino at the time of the stop fall short of reasonable suspicion
Defendant who challenges the traffic stop performed by Officer Reyes of the Freer Police Department, claiming that the stop was illegal or a pretextual stop and that Officer Reyes overstepped the scope of the stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol Agent with nearly seven years of experience, including a year and a half at the Freer checkpoint, which has led him to recognize most vehicles passing down FM 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRI: Defendants whose vehicles were stopped by law enforcement officers, and who were suspected of being involved in alien smuggling activities
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino and Marco Montemayor: Border Patrol agents involved in the investigation and interview of Ignacio Rodriguez
